LocationDescription: between CFA and Tepper School of Business
Title: Krauss Campo
Artist: Mel Bochner and Michael Van Valkenburgh Associates
Notes: Gift of Jill Gansman Kraus (A '64) and Peter Krauss
Information: A campo is a field or central gathering place within a city. This campo is a unique collaboration combining art, landscape design and horticulture. Quoted is Wittgenstein on the passage of time. The text has been been written word for word in reverse order. The space provides an escape from the pressure and tensions of everyday life. The sculpture is a french curve with numbers symbolizing lifeâ€™s ever surprising combination of order and chance.
